Hmm. These RAWR! releases gather tons of great seeders (thanks!), ratio. Verdict: Keep on fuckin' off, leechin' fools!

It's not that people don't know how to open rar files (though I'm sure newer people don't), it's that there's no point in having them at all nowadays. Do the people who compress potential torrents into rar files think they are actually doing people a favour, that they are reducing the size of the torrent considerably?

A video file - like this one - compressed to a rar file isn't going to reduce it's size. The same goes for other video formats, and iso's also. And yet a lot of torrents inexplicably have to be uncompressed. And then there are those torrents that have rar files within rar files! Why?

Compressed files are for those that are really big and that CAN ACTUALLY HAVE THEIR SIZE REDUCED. You're not going to reduce video sizes, so why bother?

There is another reason why people dislike RAR's. Even though in this day and age hard drive space is cheap, it still means  uncompressing and viewing a video file takes up twice the space - 1) to keep the rar'd files and 2) to keep the video file. This means that people are more likely to delete (and hence, not fully seed, if at all) the rar'd files.
